org.globus.opensaml11.md.common
Interface RelyingParty

All Superinterfaces:
ServiceProvider
All Known Implementing Classes:
ServiceProviderMapper.RelyingPartyImpl, ServiceProviderMapper.UnknownProviderWrapper
public interface RelyingParty
extends ServiceProvider

Defines a relationship between service providers and an identity provider. In Shibboleth parlance, a relying party represents a SP or group of SPs (perhaps a federation).

Author:
Walter Hoehn

          The authentication method that should be included in assertions to the RelyingParty, if one is not found in HTTP request headers.
 String getDefaultTarget()
          Returns the default "TARGET" attribute to be used with the artifact profile or null if none is specified.

          Returns the appropriate identity provider to create assertions for this relying party.

Methods inherited from interface org.globus.opensaml11.md.common.ServiceProvider
getProviderId
 

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Returns the name of the relying party. If the relying party is a Shibboleth SP (not a group), this function returns the same thing as ServiceProvider.getProviderId().

Returns:
name of the relying party

getIdentityProvider

IdentityProvider getIdentityProvider()
Returns the appropriate identity provider to create assertions for this relying party.

Returns:
the identity provider

getNameMapperIds

String[] getNameMapperIds()
Returns an array of identifiers for looking up the name mappings to be used when responding to queries from this RelyingParty. The array is ordered by the preference that should be given to use of the given name mappings.

Returns:
the ids of the mappers

isLegacyProvider

boolean isLegacyProvider()
Returns a boolean indication of whether this RelyingPartyis running <= Shibboleth v1.1. Used to ensure backward compatibility.

getAAUrl

URL getAAUrl()
Returns the location of the Shibboleth Attribute Authority that should answer requests for this RelyingParty.

Returns:
the URL

getDefaultAuthMethod

URI getDefaultAuthMethod()
The authentication method that should be included in assertions to the RelyingParty, if one is not found in HTTP request headers.

Returns:
the identifier for the method

passThruErrors

boolean passThruErrors()
A boolean indication of whether internal errors should be transmitted to this RelyingParty

forceAttributePush

boolean forceAttributePush()
A boolean indication of whether attributes should be pushed without regard for the profile (POST vs. Artifact). This should be be mutually exclusive with forceAttributeNoPush().

forceAttributeNoPush

boolean forceAttributeNoPush()
A boolean indication of whether attributes should be NOT pushed without regard for the profile (POST vs. Artifact).

defaultToPOSTProfile

boolean defaultToPOSTProfile()
A boolean indication of whether the default SSO browser profile should be POST or Artifact. "true" indicates POST and "false" indicates Artifact.

wantsAssertionsSigned

boolean wantsAssertionsSigned()
A boolean indication of whether assertions issued to this Relying Party should be digitally signed (This is in addition to profile-specific signing).

singleAssertion

boolean singleAssertion()
A boolean indication of whether attributes sent with an authentication response should be included in the same assertion or left in a second assertion for compatibility with broken SAML products.

getPreferredArtifactType

int getPreferredArtifactType()
Returns the type of SAML Artifact that this appropriate for use with this Relying Party.

getDefaultTarget

String getDefaultTarget()
Returns the default "TARGET" attribute to be used with the artifact profile or null if none is specified.

wantsSchemaHack

boolean wantsSchemaHack()
Boolean indicator of whether or not the legacy schema hack should be used. Older versions of xerces require (xsi:type="typens:AttributeValueType") on the attribute value to get around a validation bug.
